intro: Pterygodium schelpei, commonly known as the African arrowroot, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, which includes orchids, and is characterized by its unique, tubular flowers. The plant produces a starchy underground tuber that is used as a food source in some regions. Its botanical features include strap-like leaves and a rhizomatous growth habit. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in grassland and woodland habitats.
